intro: Barleria spicata, commonly known as red-hot poker, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking spikes of bright red or orange tubular flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Barleria spicata is also known for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
